header.title: Class 2 - Air 2
authors: Esoteric School of Shamanism and Magic
header.category: Western Esotericism, Elemental Magic, Shamanism, Occultism

central_thesis: The core premise of this magical system is that a magician's deep understanding and practical manipulation of the four elements, their specific characteristics, and correspondences enables the understanding and recreation of any phenomenon in the Universe. This class specifically focuses on the Air element, its colors, and the operative technique of 'air boxes' to balance and influence physical, mental, and spiritual states.

structure_content.summary: Emphasizes the importance of preparatory study, including reviewing 'Explorations' and consistently carrying index cards with air characteristics and correspondences to facilitate their internalization and readiness for practice.

Highlights the necessity of mastering 14 air characteristics to achieve universal understanding and the ability to discern and re-create the inherent qualities of any object, which is foundational to the course's premise.

Details the specific colors associated with the Air element – Clear for physical aspects (breathing, sight, sensations), White for mental aspects (thinking, learning, memory), and Air Blue/Sky Blue for spiritual aspects (understanding, enlightenment, psychic perceptives) – outlining their nourishing and preventative effects on various bodily and energetic functions.

Introduces 'air boxes' as energetic constructs, created by hand aura, to precisely add or subtract specific air colors and characteristics from one's energy balances. It covers the step-by-step procedure for constructing, filling, taking in, observing results, and properly destroying these boxes, stressing the importance of exact execution for desired outcomes.

Provides a diagnostic guide for identifying specific shortages or excesses of Clear (physical), White (mental), and Sky Blue (spiritual) air, detailing symptoms like shortness of breath, mind blankness, or lack of understanding. It notes the complexity of overlapping imbalances and the need for personal experience to accurately diagnose.

Describes a formal closing ritual, 'Sky Above and Earth Below, Seeking Knowledge, I Greet You,' which involves consciously placing one's awareness in the sky and earth to respectfully greet powers and beings before concluding magical work, emphasizing the need to wait for a response.

key_concepts.definition: Corresponds to the mind, thought, knowledge, understanding, and enlightenment. It is one of the four fundamental elements whose mastery is central to universal understanding in this magical system.

The relationships and connections between the characteristics of the Air element and specific physical, mental, and spiritual phenomena, enabling a magician to understand the inherent qualities of anything in the Universe.

An energetic, self-cohesive construct, typically a cube or rectangle (7-9 inches per side), created by the aura energy of the hands. It is filled with a specific air color and/or characteristic to manipulate and balance a practitioner's elemental energies.

Any visible manifestation of a desired color (e.g., lit candle, color chips, clear glass, ambient air) from which elemental energy is drawn to fill an air box. Imagination is explicitly discouraged; only seen sources are to be used.

Specific qualities or attributes of the Air element (e.g., 'Breathing' for Physical/Clear, 'Thinking' for Mental/White, 'Understanding' for Spiritual/Sky Blue) that can be isolated and incorporated into air boxes to target specific energetic adjustments.

Focused, total involvement and concentration on the magical action, free from 'mental chatter,' worry, or distraction. It is crucial for the success and effectiveness of magical procedures, as fear and divided attention destroy control.
The ability to accurately perceive and discern the subtle energetic effects and results of magical procedures, which practitioners develop through experiential practice.

Universal laws governing magical responsibility, implying that a magician is accountable for the consequences of their actions, even unintended ones, especially when interacting with energetic constructs or beings.

practical_system.description: The practical system revolves around the energetic construction and manipulation of 'air boxes' to achieve precise elemental (Air) balancing. Practitioners learn to form these ephemeral boxes using their hand's aura energy, fill them with specific air colors (Clear, White, Sky Blue) and/or characteristics (e.g., Breathing, Thinking, Understanding) drawn from visible 'color sources,' and then 'take in' or 'breathe in' the box to integrate its energies. The system includes procedures for both increasing and decreasing specific air balances, emphasizes rigorous adherence to steps, and necessitates careful observation and recording of results for personal development and diagnosis of energetic shortages or excesses. The ultimate goal is to understand and control elemental energies to influence personal states and, by extension, universal phenomena.
tools: Index cards (for carrying air characteristics and correspondences)
Class color chips (for accurate color identification and as color sources)
Lit candle (as a color source for pulling energy)
Clear glass (as a color source for 'clear' air)
Hands (as the primary tool for generating aura energy to form air boxes)
US Postal Service Priority Mail boxes (as physical guides for conceptualizing air box size)
Air boxes sheet (for recording dates, times, direction of box use, and observed effects)
rituals: Building an empty air box using aura energy from hands (forming top/bottom, then front/back, then sides).
Filling the air box with a desired air color from a visible color source (e.g., candle, color chips, clear glass).
Filling the air box with a specific air characteristic, visualized as words (e.g., neon white letters).
Taking in the air box by bringing it to the face and 'snorting' or breathing it in.
Taking off/removing the air box (after increasing balances) by building an empty box, breathing out the color and characteristic into it, and then destroying the box.
Decreasing air balances (similar to taking off, but with explicit intent to reduce).
Exit Ritual: 'Sky Above and Earth Below, Seeking Knowledge, I Greet You' (placing consciousness up, then down, then speaking the greeting, waiting for response).

relevant_quotes.text: Remember, the premise of this course is that a magician's understanding of the 4 elements, their correspondences, and their characteristics allows him or her to understand anything in the Universe. Once you have an understanding of the four elements plus their correspondences and characteristics, you can look at any object and know its inherent characteristics. Then, you will know how to re-create it.
REMEMBER: ALTERED PROCEDURES PRODUCE ALTERED RESULTS!
PRINCIPLE: Treat the four element energies with respect, and not fear. Fear destroys the ability to exercise proper control!!

critical_analysis.relevance: This document is highly relevant to practitioners engaged in practical elemental magic, particularly those focused on self-improvement and energetic balancing. It provides a systematic, step-by-step methodology for directly manipulating elemental energies for tangible effects on physical, mental, and spiritual well-being. The emphasis on 'operative' magic, direct experience, and precise procedural adherence positions it as a valuable instructional text for those seeking to develop practical skills in energy work. Its core thesis aligns with Hermetic principles of understanding universal correspondences to gain mastery over creation.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience is students of the 'Esoteric School of Shamanism and Magic,' specifically those progressing through foundational elemental studies. It is suitable for aspiring and practicing occultists interested in a structured, experiential approach to elemental balancing and energy manipulation. It would also appeal to individuals exploring practical applications of esoteric philosophy for personal development and energetic self-regulation, requiring a disciplined mindset and willingness to engage in direct magical practice.
